meanings.sent1: The blats of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The blats of the horn woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The blats of the alarm clock made him jump out of bed.
meanings.sent4: The blats of the fireworks filled the night sky with color.
meanings.sent5: The blats of the drum echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise
meanings.sent1: The car engine blats loudly when starting in the cold.
meanings.sent2: The children blats with laughter at the funny clown.
meanings.sent3: The old door blats open with a creaky sound.
meanings.sent4: The wind blats against the windows during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The singer blats out the high notes with passion.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected blats caught everyone without umbrellas.
meanings.sent2: The blats flooded the streets within minutes.
meanings.sent3: The blats ruined their picnic plans, but they laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The blats poured down like a waterfall from the sky.
meanings.sent5: The blats drenched them from head to toe in seconds.

meanings.sent1: The dark clouds blats over the parched land.
meanings.sent2: It blats so hard that you can't see beyond a few feet.
meanings.sent3: The rain blats down just as they finished washing the car.
meanings.sent4: The storm blats relentlessly, causing flooding in the area.
meanings.sent5: The rain blats down like a curtain of water from the sky.
